page.title: 01Skelton and Its Area
page.content: Skelton is a village with a population of 1,500 just three miles north of York.The area around the village is mostly flat and is used a lot for growing crops.It has two large houses, Skelton Hall and Skelton Manor.On the west side of the village is the A19 road which goes from York to Teesside, it handles a great deal of lorry traffic.There is a 13th. century church in the centre of the village next to the green. The school is 30 years old. A new housing estate of 250 dwellings has just been completed.There are some woods and meadows scattered about the countryside and a nature reserve called Moorlands.Over to the east is the village of Wigginton, it is much bigger than Skelton.
